FOUND IN: Scarce - In short supply, hard to find or obtain.
Ironing - Using an iron to smooth out wrinkles in fabric through direct application of heat and pressure.
Erase - To remove or eliminate something by wiping it away.
Crane - Long-legged and long-necked heron species characterized by their graceful movements; they are often seen standing motionless in shallow waters waiting for prey to approach.
Hoard - to accumulate and store away resources, often excessively.
Asset - A useful and valuable resource owned by an individual or organization; can be tangible (physical property) or intangible (experience or reputation).
Eggplant - The most commonly used English term for this purple-hued, vegetable fruit.
Stonemason - A skilled craftsman who works with stone, shaping and constructing it for various architectural purposes.
Satan - The figure representing ultimate evil, infamous in Christian belief as the prince of darkness.
